1610162257_191jbK3GNmVritcMymKkFuxyYFXxq.body:
> [bicklevov](#comment_1_18tBB7LRsGcCYkAU5fNDwTMADzVzHFa5rm): i like the decentralized networks, but the next threat to these are IPs. how do you get around that?

Tor routing helps to hide your IP address

> [bimmyql](#comment_2_1yhTF4WKRZsCBdVeh8fwPj14zAiEdtAXW): care to elaborate? what are "IPs", do you mean Internet Service Providers?

Every device you have that is connected to the internet has a unique IP (Internet Protocol) address that identifies it on the global network, so when you connect to any website, that website can see your IP address and know (approximately) where you are.
